title: Scottish make up artist Connie Kirwan from Kilsyth gets PrettyLittleThing devils horns stuck to head
text:
This is the hilarious moment a make-up artist getting ready for Halloween superglues a pair of devil horns to her head - and then can't get them off.

Connie Kirwan, 21, from Kilsyth, North Lanarkshire posted a series of videos showing how the £4 PrettyLittleThing horns were stuck fast to her forehead.

They were so difficult to remove, she feared she'd have to go to A&E to get rid of the Satanic special effects.

Connie Kirwan, 21, (pictured) from Kilsyth, North Lanarkshire posted a series of videos showing how the £4 PrettyLittleThing horns were stuck fast to her forehead

'At first I thought it was funny, but then the longer it took me to get them off I actually started to panic,' she said.

'I ran into my mum's room and told her she needs to help me get them off but she didn't think I was being serious.

'I tried soaking them in warm water and baby oil but nothing seemed to work.

'When it got to about 1:30am and I just ended up grabbing them and basically ripping them off my head. It was so sore.'

Miss Kirwan bought the Halloween horns online to add to her get-up for October 31 and couldn't resist trying them out.

Her friend Leigh Burke uploaded images of the resulting mayhem to social media with the caption: 'Hahahahahahaha - Connie was trying a new Halloween look and now she can't get the horns off her head.

'I swear stuff like this only happens to her'

In the clip, Miss Kirwan is seen pulling at the red horns trying to remove them.

She can also be heard saying: 'Do you think I can email PrettyLittleThing and say your horns are f****** faulty because I can't get them off my head?'

Miss Kirwan then tries to pull at it again, but has no luck and says: 'It's actual lifting my whole eye.'

In another clip, Miss Kirwan can still be seen with the horns on and says: 'Update - makeup is off horns are f****** not. I'm going to need to go to A&E.'

Miss Kirwan (pictured, wearing the PrettyLittleThing horns) bought the Halloween horns online to add to her get-up for October 31 and couldn't resist trying them out. But they became stuck fast, and she couldn't remove them for around four hours

Miss Kirwan herself then posted a clip to Leigh's post which the words 'been like this for over an hour now' were written across the video.

She says: 'Just thought I would let everyone know not to f***** order these horns from PrettyLittleThing, because apparently I've f***** surgically glued them to my head' before giving the camera a thumbs up and saying: Here we go.' move them.

Social media users were in hysterics over the footage.

Twitter user Jonny Regae said: 'That is f***** quality! F*** my life, hope you didn't have to go to work like that.'

Alex Burke commented: 'This video is so underrated Hahahahah here we go.'

Coral Walters said: 'This is something that would happen to me.'

While another said: 'Deffo crossing this off the potentials list.'

Others wanted to know if she had managed to eventually remove the horns.

One said: 'I just want to know if @connie-kirwan has managed to get those horns off her head yet.'

Another Twitter user said: 'Can we have an update please, are they off?'

To which Connie replied to at half nine last night saying: 'They are off finally.'

Pretty Little Thing declined to comment.
description: Connie Kirwan, 21, from Kilsyth, North Lanarkshire posted a series of videos showing how the £4 PrettyLittleThing horns were stuck fast to her forehead.
